name: politico
text: More than 70 people — including politicians, administration officials and the president’s family — will be featured over four days beginning Monday https://t.co/gHrj37TbUL

name: politico
text: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi defended her endorsement of Rep. Joe Kennedy in his Democratic Senate primary, saying "people can support whoever they want" https://t.co/7CJl7P1BCO

name: politico
text: The president’s claim that the FDA is delaying clinical trials for the coronavirus vaccine for political reasons is his way of making some at the agency “feel the heat” and push forward, White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows said https://t.co/iQDEDDTIS1

name: politico
text: Joe Biden has two words for President Trump on his fitness for office: “Watch me" https://t.co/q6qMIbwx7m

name: politico
text: BREAKING: White House counselor Kellyanne Conway, one of President Donald Trump’s longest-serving aides, announced late Sunday she is leaving the White House https://t.co/Gmf4glkX8w

name: politico
text: White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows challenged the credibility of the Trump family member who released tapes in which the president’s older sister said Donald Trump “has no principles" https://t.co/7HuilfNTuR

name: politico
text: President Trump is pushing for law enforcement at polling places for safety reasons, not voter suppression, White House chief of staff Mark Meadows said https://t.co/jOWcE35KrP

name: politico
text: RNC Chair Ronna McDaniel said the GOP will pay for all Republican National Convention events, dodging a report that Secretary of State Mike Pompeo will address the convention while on an official trip to the Middle East https://t.co/A7BXqZw8i8

name: politico
text: Chuck Schumer is still distrusted by some on the left. But on the verge of seizing the Senate, the New York Democrat insists his views have shifted to reflect a different constituency https://t.co/EmOamDUC87

name: politico
text: As the Republican convention looms, Trump and his team have scrambled to find ways to quell concerns about the question that has bedeviled him for months: What would he do with four more years? https://t.co/h4jeTaa3Ls

name: politico
text:

text: More than two dozen Republican former lawmakers endorsed Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden on Monday https://t.co/5vfdCqgAkP

text: The House Ethics Committee's investigation into Rep. Matt Gaetz revealed that the Panhandle Republican went to Fox News star Sean Hannity for advice.  The House report includes this text exchange between Gaetz and Hannity that happened in February 2019 https://t.co/9MNzA3TO2h https://t.co/TtZ8VgelvP

text: White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows on Kellyanne Conway's departure: "It’ll be a big hole, a big blow to us” https://t.co/xmtlo6aYPS

text: The House Oversight panel will grill Postmaster General Louis DeJoy today about whether the USPS is equipped to handle a surge of mail-in voting ahead of the November election https://t.co/XgpWz4kmNO

text:
Party platform? Pass. Second-term vision? Skip. Republicans kick off their convention today after just four weeks of planning.

text: House Oversight Committee Chairwoman Carolyn Maloney (D-N.Y.) accused Postmaster General DeJoy of misleading Congress and sabotaging the postal service to support President Trump’s political goals https://t.co/Qq9m2sJWMU

name: politico
text: If Democrats flip control of the Senate this fall, Chuck Schumer is poised to make history: as Senate majority leader, he would be both the first Jewish lawmaker and first New Yorker to hold that post https://t.co/VNb7FbPTJR

name: politico
text: The Republican convention kicks off this morning, with delegates meeting in Charlotte, N.C. (the original host city), to formally nominate President Donald Trump for reelection https://t.co/Gb1k6Q9KGF

name: politico
text: A House bill introduced today would force the Trump administration to cover the full cost of National Guard deployments across the U.S. for the duration of the coronavirus pandemic, regardless of when it ends https://t.co/lwiPbdDMSf

name: politico
text: Democrats worry damage has already been done to weaken the Postal Service’s capacity ahead of the November elections https://t.co/VQJNQVGfiI

name: politico
text: TikTok is suing the Trump administration today for essentially banning its popular video-sharing app in the U.S. https://t.co/poHjB8ciAY

name: politico
text:
Dems accused Postmaster General Louis DeJoy of downplaying disruptions to mail delivery that began when he assumed his position in July, threatening to subpoena him for what they say is deliberate withholding of internal decision-making documents.
https://t.co/VQJNQVGfiI

name: politico
text: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro today exaggerated the efficacy of blood plasma as a coronavirus treatment, urging Americans to disregard any skepticism of the controversial therapy https://t.co/TdLiYeZFe7

name: politico
text: Parents banding together to create “learning pods” for the new school year are rattling the education world. The small-group learning phenomenon is driving concerns about wealthier kids getting an unfair leg up. https://t.co/BVMHAQfCiR
